title: Slim 3.5 PHP errors cause fatal errors in the error handler
body:
In Slim 3.5 on php 7 I am encountering this php error when Slim attempts to handle php errors:

> `Fatal error: Uncaught TypeError: Argument 1 passed to Slim\Handlers\Error::renderHtmlException() must be an instance of Exception, instance of Error given, called in path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/Handlers/Error.php on line 84 and defined in path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/Handlers/Error.php:110 Stack trace: #0 path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/Handlers/Error.php(84): Slim\Handlers\Error->renderHtmlException(Object(Error)) #1 path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/Handlers/Error.php(48): Slim\Handlers\Error->renderHtmlErrorMessage(Object(Error)) #2 [internal function]: Slim\Handlers\Error->__invoke(Object(Slim\Http\Request), Object(Slim\Http\Response), Object(PDOException)) #3 path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/App.php(613): call_user_func_array(Object(Slim\Handlers\Error), Array) #4 path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/App.php(339): Slim\App->handleException(Object(PDOExc in path/vendor/slim/slim/Slim/Handlers/Error.php on line 110`

(adjusted to remove paths)

This appears to be this issue: https://akrabat.com/improved-error-handling-in-slim-3-2-0/ (Specfically, the PHP 7 heading)

As I say, I am on Slim 3.5, which I have confirmed through composer and updated just in case. Has this been reverted by accident? 

Here is the method as it appears in my current codebase:

```
protected function renderHtmlException(\Exception $exception)
    {
        $title = 'Slim Application Error';
//more exciting code
```

And the exact composer version: slim/slim 3.5.0 

If it is relevant, I think the error is originating in a PDO class fetch, but its a little difficult to tell.
